channel.title: Payments
channel.description: I suggest you incorporate google checkout to your payment methods for the sponsored server bids. It's extremely easy to integrate, and it's better than paypal imo.

item.title: Payments
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

Moparisthebest:

A couple of hours are hard to come by nowadays. I’ll try to give it a shot though.

http://custom.simplemachines.org/mods/index.php?mod=3820

There’s an SMF mod I released, while you wouldn’t be able to use it as a simple install and go, you can rip the code from it to integrate google wallet without any effort. Since the mod is released under the BSD license, you’re free to do so. Anyway, it couldn’t hurt, and google wallet is a great payment platform.

Read full topic

item.title: Payments
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

I agree, a secondary form of payment would be greatly appreciated. I myself am perm banned from paypal and have no chance at having a paypal account. It has hindered my ability to pay for advertising.
I’m sure others are in the same boat I am.

Read full topic

item.title: Payments
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

When you set it up using the Google Wallet API, it will continue to work after checkout is taken down. Google Checkout is being replaced by Google Wallet. Take a look at my site’s donation system, when you get to the Google part, it shows Google Wallet logos instead of checkout. Once checkout is removed in November, I should be unaffected.

Google Developers

Google Pay API  |  Google Developers

Optimize the checkout experience for your users.

That’s what you want, “Wallet for digital goods” You’ll see the integration process is actually incredibly easy, and can be done in a matter of a couple of hours.

I want to bid this month, but I’m not sure if I’ll be able to pay with PayPal, as they’re giving me a hard time…If you setup Google Wallet before the bidding ends, I should have no problem at all paying for my bid, and you know I always pay for my bid moments after the bidding ends. =)

Read full topic
